title: Genre Overview
text: A brief introduction to the genre of Role-Playing Games and a navigation hub. Learn about core mechanics like XP and stats.

title: The Foundation
text: Tabletop origins (D&D) and early console classics. Explore character progression and turn-based combat systems.

title: The Modern Era
text: The evolution into MMOs and massive open-world environments. Discover action combat and player freedom.

title: Dungeons & Dragons
text: The game that started it all. The original blueprint for stats, classes, and experience points.

title: Final Fantasy I
text: Square Enix's genre-saving classic that brought JRPGs to the masses with cinematic scope.

title: Dragon Quest
text: The first true console RPG, popularizing the concept of 'grinding' and structured narrative paths.

title: The MMO Boom
text: The 2000s saw the explosion of persistent online worlds like WoW, EVE, and EverQuest. Massive scale.

title: Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
text: A benchmark for open-world design, non-linear quests, and environmental storytelling.

title: The Witcher 3
text: A modern masterpiece focused on morally grey narrative choices and mature themes in a fantasy setting.

title: Action RPGs
text: Combat driven by player reflexes and hitboxes rather than dice rolls. Think Diablo, Kingdom Hearts, and Souls-likes.

title: Indie Revival
text: Games like Disco Elysium and Undertale prove that deep narrative and mechanics can exist without AAA budgets.

title: Tabletop Renaissance
text: The resurgence of D&D and other TTRPGs, fueled by streaming and digital tools.

title: CRPG Revival
text: Classic PC-style RPGs making a comeback, focusing on party management and deep dialogue trees.

title: The Loot Grind
text: The mechanic of randomized, tiered gear drops (loot) driving long-term player engagement. Think Destiny and Borderlands.

title: Narrative Depth
text: Modern RPGs often tackle complex social and philosophical themes, pushing the boundaries of video game storytelling.
